intro: Banisteria pubipetala f. typica, commonly known as the velvetleaf bignay, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces elliptical, woody fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks, thriving in humid, warm climates. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
